newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's September iron output falls 63.2 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru's September iron output falls 63.2 percent.

text.p: Peru's iron output fell 63.2 percent to 109,131 tonnes in September, compared with the same month last year, according to preliminary figures from the Energy and Mines Ministry released Tuesday.
Production fell 24.2 percent to 2.232 million tonnes in the first nine months of the year, compared with the same period last year, the ministry said.
Peru's only iron miner is Chinese-owned Shougang Hierro Peru S.A, a former state-owned firm privatized in November 1992.
Shougang workers held a series of strikes throughout September.
Output of Peruvian iron dropped 14.33 percent last year to 3.897 million tons compared with 4.549 million tons in 1994.
